articles.title: Reminiscences of Kim Il Sung published abroad
articles.content:
Greetings to Zimbabwean President 
    Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on April 12 sent a message of greetings to Robert G. Mugabe, President of Zimbabwe, on the occasion of the 22nd anniversary of the Republic of Zimbabwe.
 The message wished the president and the people of Zimbabwe greater success in their work to defend the sovereignty of the country and achieve prosperity and expressed belief that the good friendly relations existing between the two countries would continue to grow stronger.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam meets foreign guests
Agreement on friendship and cooperation between WPK and PDPN signed

articles.content:
Agreement on friendship and cooperation between WPK and PDPN signed 
     Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) -- An agreement on friendship and cooperation between the Workers' Party of Korea and the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria was signed in Pyongyang yesterday.
 Present at the signing ceremony on the WPK side were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, and officials concerned and on the opposite side were the members of the delegation of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria led by Muhammed Inuwa Rabaran, national organizational secretary of the party.    
 The agreement was inked by Choe Thae Bok and Muhammed Inuwa Rabaran.

articles.title: U.S. urged to drop policy of Cold War
articles.content:
Talks held between delegations of WPK and PDPN 
    Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea and the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria were held in Pyongyang yesterday.
 Present at the talks on the WPK side were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, and officials concerned and on the opposite side were the members of the delegation of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria led by Muhammed Inuwa Rabaran, national organizational secretary of the party.    
 The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.content:
Experience of cultivation of Kimilsungia swapped 
    Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) -- A meeting for swapping the experience in cultivating Kimilsungia took place yesterday at a time when the 4th kimilsungia show is going on before full house.
 Present there were officials concerned, researchers, floriculturists and cultivators of the flower of the sun from the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, commissions and ministries of the cabinet, national institutions, provinces and other units.    
 The swappers introduced the experience gained in cultivating Kimilsungia and using flower pots and data giving scientific and technological answers to the important matters in cultivating Kimilsungia including the method of nutrition management and the method of cultivation by stimulator.

articles.content:
Rally of "day of all-people action" held in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) -- The reunification solidarity for the implementation of the June 15 South-North Joint Declaration and the peace on the Korean Peninsula reportedly held the 6th rally of the "day of all-people action" in Seoul on April 15.
 Kim Kyu Chol, permanent representative of the solidarity, in an address said that the June 15 joint declaration clarified the truth to the people who have been deceived till now. He referred to the change of conscience of the South Korean people after the publication of the joint declaration.    
 Ri Chon Jae, permanent chairman of the "Seoul Federation," in a political speech titled "We are opposed to the U.S. threatening the June 15 joint declaration" said that a true peace on the Korean Peninsula cannot be achieved now as long as the south and the north remain divided. In order to conduct free exchange and cooperation between the south and the north it is imperative to settle more fundamental issues including the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from South Korea and the conclusion of a peace agreement, he added.
